abstract.original_text: A new tentative lyssavirus, Lleida bat lyssavirus, was found in a bent-winged bat (Miniopterus schreibersii) in Spain. It does not belong to phylogroups I or II, and it seems to be more closely related to the West Causasian bat virus, and especially to the Ikoma lyssavirus.

sentences.segment_text: A new tentative lyssavirus , Lleida bat lyssavirus ,
was found in a bent-winged bat ( Miniopterus schreibersii ) in Spain .
It does not belong to phylogroups I or II ,
and it seems to be more closely related to the West Causasian bat virus ,
and especially to the Ikoma lyssavirus .
